com.wit.android.widget.adapter.module

Class SelectionModule<Adapter extends AdapterModule.ModuleAdapter>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wit.android.widget.adapter.module.AdapterModule<Adapter>
      • com.wit.android.widget.adapter.module.SelectionModule<Adapter>
  • Type Parameters:
    Adapter - Type of the adapter for which can be this selection module created and used.

    public class SelectionModule<Adapter extends AdapterModule.ModuleAdapter>
extends AdapterModule<Adapter>

    Class Overview

    Selection module for IMultiAdapter.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.wit.android.widget.adapter.module.AdapterModule

      Sets the current selection mode of this module to the specified one.

      Changes selection state of an item at the specified position to the opposite one (selected -> unselected; unselected -> selected) and notifies adapter.

        public SelectionModule()

    • Method Detail

      • isSelected

        public boolean isSelected(int position)

        Checks whether an item at the specified position is currently selected or not.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of an item from the current adapter's data set.
        Returns:
        True if an item at the specified position is selected, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setItemSelected(int, boolean), toggleItemSelectionState(int)

      • toggleItemSelectionState

        public void toggleItemSelectionState(int position)

        Changes selection state of an item at the specified position to the opposite one (selected -> unselected; unselected -> selected) and notifies adapter.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of an item from the current adapter's data set.
        See Also:
        setItemSelected(int, boolean)

      • setItemSelected

        public void setItemSelected(int position,
                   boolean selected)

        Sets the given selection state for an item at the specified position and notifies adapter.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of an item from the current adapter's data set.
        selected - New selection state.
        See Also:
        selectRange(int, int), selectAll(), toggleItemSelectionState(int), AdapterModule.isAdapterNotificationEnabled()

      • selectAll

        public void selectAll()

        Same as selectRange(int, int) with parameters (0, getAdapter().getCount()).

        See Also:
        selectRange(int, int), setItemSelected(int, boolean)

      • selectRange

        public void selectRange(int startPosition,
               int count)

        Marks an items from the current adapter's data set in the range <startPosition, startPosition + count> as selected and notifies adapter.

        Parameters:
        startPosition - Start position for selection.
        count - Count of items to select from the start position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the current mode isn't set to MODE_MULTIPLE.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If startPosition + count > n.
        See Also:
        selectAll(), setItemSelected(int, boolean), AdapterModule.isAdapterNotificationEnabled()

      • clearSelection

        public void clearSelection()

        Marks all items from the current adapter's data set to unselected and notifies adapter.

        See Also:
        clearSelectionInRange(int, int), AdapterModule.isAdapterNotificationEnabled()

      • clearSelectionInRange

        public void clearSelectionInRange(int startPosition,
                         int count)

        Sets the selected state to true for the select-able items of attached adapter at the given positions (startPosition, startPosition + count).

        Also adapter will be notified about data set change.

        Parameters:
        startPosition - Position for selection start.
        count - Count of the items to select from the start position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If current mode isn't set to MODE_MULTIPLE.
        See Also:
        clearSelection(), AdapterModule.isAdapterNotificationEnabled()

      • getSelectedItems

        public android.util.SparseIntArray getSelectedItems()

        Returns the sparse array with currently selected items positions.

        Returns:
        SparseIntArray with select-able items positions which are in this time selected. Note that this array is sorted for optimization (from lowest to highest position).

      • getSelectedItemsCount

        public int getSelectedItemsCount()

        Returns:

      • getSelectedPosition

        public int getSelectedPosition()

        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If current mode isn't set to MODE_SINGLE.
        See Also:
        getSelectedPositions()

      • getSelectedPositions

        public int[] getSelectedPositions()

        Same as getSelectedPositions(boolean) with true, so items in array will be sorted ascending.

      • getSelectedPositions

        public int[] getSelectedPositions(boolean ascending)

        Returns array with positions of the currently selected items.

        Note, that array is obtained/processed from the SparseIntArray, so its items will be sorted ascending.

        Parameters:
        ascending - True to sort array items ascending, false to descending.
        Returns:
        Array with positions of the currently selected items.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If current mode isn't set to MODE_MULTIPLE.
        See Also:
        getSelectedPositions()

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int mode)

        Sets the current selection mode of this module to the specified one.

        Parameters:
        mode - Selection mode to set.
        See Also:
        getMode()

      • getMode

        public int getMode()

        Returns the current selection mode of this module.

        Returns:
        Selection mode, one of the MODE_MULTIPLE, MODE_SINGLE.
        See Also:
        setMode(int)

      • contains

        protected final boolean contains(int position)

        Checks whether the set of currently selected item's positions contains the specified position.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of an item from the current adapter's data set.
        Returns:
        True if the currently selected item's positions set contains specified position, false otherwise..

      • selectItem

        protected final void selectItem(int position)

        Adds the specified position into the set of currently selected positions.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of an item from the current adapter's data set.

      • deselectItem

        protected final void deselectItem(int position)

        Removes the specified position form the set of currently selected positions.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of an item from the current adapter's data set.

      • clearSelection

        protected final void clearSelection(boolean notify)

        Removes all positions form the set of currently selected positions.

        Parameters:
        notify - If set to true, adapter will be also notified about selection data set change.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        protected void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle outState)
        Description copied from class: AdapterModule

        Invoked to save state of this adapter module instance. This is invoked whenever AdapterModule.dispatchSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle) is called.

        Overrides:
        onSaveInstanceState in class AdapterModule<Adapter extends AdapterModule.ModuleAdapter>
        Parameters:
        outState - Outgoing state. Always valid bundle.
        See Also:
        AdapterModule.onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle)

      • onRestoreInstanceState

        protected void onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle savedState)
        Description copied from class: AdapterModule

        Invoked to restore state of this adapter module instance. Note, that this is invoked only in case that the bundle passed to AdapterModule.dispatchRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle) is valid.

        Overrides:
        onRestoreInstanceState in class AdapterModule<Adapter extends AdapterModule.ModuleAdapter>
        Parameters:
        savedState - Bundle with saved data populated in the AdapterModule.onSaveInstanceState(Bundle). Always valid bundle.
